channel.title: Thelema Coast to Coast
channel.description: Thelema Coast to Coast: The podcast dedicated to the exploration of Thelema, Aleister Crowley, the New Aeon, ceremonial magick, and the occult.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2005-2007 Luxor Press, Inc. All rights reserved.
channel.itunes:author: John L. Crow
channel.itunes:subtitle: The podcast dedicated to the exploration of Thelema, Aleister Crowley, the New Aeon, ceremonial magick, and the occult. Thelema Coast to Coast: Occultism Without Apologies.
channel.itunes:summary: A series of interviews and commentaries about the current state of the occult communities, especially concentrating on Thelemic organizations, Thelemic practitioners and writers, as well as books and other resources of interest to Thelemites and occultists. Thelema Coast to Coast: Occultism Without Apologies.
channel.itunes:link: Thelema Coast to Coast: Occultism Without Apologies.

item.title: TCTC #44, 12-31-07
item.itunes:author: Thelema Coast to Coast
item.itunes:summary: Thelema Coast to Coast show #44; Announcement: Thelema Coast to Coast if going off the air until further notice; Discussion with Keith418; Closing Music: Clarmaggeddon by Thelema Trio.
item.description: Thelema Coast to Coast show #44; Announcement: Thelema Coast to Coast if going off the air until further notice; Discussion with Keith418; Closing Music: Clarmaggeddon by Thelema Trio.
item.itunes:keywords: John L. Crow Thelema esoteric occult Aleister Crowley Ordo Templi Orientis OTO AA Pagan Keith418 Thelema Trio Clarmaggeddon

item.title: TCTC #43, 10-6-07
item.itunes:author: Thelema Coast to Coast
item.itunes:summary: Thelema Coast to Coast show #43; Opening Remarks; Interview Niki Hughes about the Gnosis Festival; Discussion with Keith418 looking at Thelema, is it a religion?; Interview with David Rankine about the new Golden Hoard book, The Goetia of Dr Rudd; Closing Music: Hymn of Pan by Coph Nia.
item.description: Thelema Coast to Coast show #43; Opening Remarks; Interview Niki Hughes about the Gnosis Festival; Discussion with Keith418 looking at Thelema, is it a religion?; Interview with David Rankine about the new Golden Hoard book, The Goetia of Dr Rudd; Closing Music: Hymn of Pan by Coph Nia.
item.itunes:keywords: John L. Crow Thelema esoteric occult Aleister Crowley Ordo Templi Orientis OTO AA Pagan Keith418 Gnosis Festival David Rankine Golden Horde The Goetia of Dr Rudd Hymn of Pan Coph Nia

item.title: TCTC #42, 6-27-07
item.itunes:author: Thelema Coast to Coast
item.itunes:summary: Thelema Coast to Coast show #42; Opening Remarks; Listener feedback; Interview with William Kiesel of Ouroboros Press; Discussion with Keith418 about Hegelian concept on the master and slave relationship and its application to Thelema; Interview with David Jones about the Enochian system and in particular the four elemental table; Closing remarks; Closing music: The Four Horsemen performed by Aphrodites Child.
item.description: Thelema Coast to Coast show #42; Opening Remarks; Listener feedback; Interview with William Kiesel of Ouroboros Press; Discussion with Keith418 about Hegelian concept on the master and slave relationship and its application to Thelema; Interview with David Jones about the Enochian system and in particular the four elemental table; Closing remarks; Closing music: The Four Horsemen performed by Aphrodites Child.
item.itunes:keywords: John L. Crow Thelema esoteric occult Aleister Crowley Ordo Templi Orientis OTO AA Pagan Keith418 David Jones. Enochian Initiation Hegel Ouroboros Press

item.title: TCTC #41, 5-29-07
item.itunes:author: Thelema Coast to Coast
item.itunes:summary: Thelema Coast to Coast show #41; Opening Remarks; Listener feedback; Discussion with Jon Sewell about his production of the Rite of Venus; Discussion with Keith418 about the leadership in the OTO and the Thelemic community; Interview with Frater W.I.T. about his book, Enochian Initiation; Closing remarks; Closing music: Adorations performed by The Rite of Venus cast.
item.description: Thelema Coast to Coast show #41; Opening Remarks; Listener feedback; Discussion with Jon Sewell about his production of the Rite of Venus; Discussion with Keith418 about the leadership in the OTO and the Thelemic community; Interview with Frater W.I.T. about his book, Enochian Initiation; Closing remarks; Closing music: Adorations performed by The Rite of Venus cast.
item.itunes:keywords: John L. Crow Thelema esoteric occult Aleister Crowley Ordo Templi Orientis OTO AA Pagan Keith418 Frater W.I.T. Enochian Initiation Jon Sewell Rite of Venus

item.title: TCTC #40, 3-31-07
item.itunes:author: Thelema Coast to Coast
item.itunes:summary: Thelema Coast to Coast show #40; Opening Remarks; Listener feedback; Discussion with Monica Rocha regarding her English translation of Marcelo Mottas Astral Attack and Defense; Discussion with Keith418 about the current state of Crowley publishing in the Thelemic community; Interview with Alfred Vitale about using media as ritual technology; Closing remarks; Closing music: IO Pan performed by The Russian OTO
item.description: Thelema Coast to Coast show #40; Opening Remarks; Listener feedback; Discussion with Monica Rocha regarding her English translation of Marcelo Mottas Astral Attack and Defense; Discussion with Keith418 about the current state of Crowley publishing in the Thelemic community; Interview with Alfred Vitale about using media as ritual technology; Closing remarks; Closing music: IO Pan performed by The Russian OTO
item.itunes:keywords: John L. Crow Thelema esoteric occult Aleister Crowley Ordo Templi Orientis OTO AA Pagan Keith418 Marcela Motta Astral Attack Defense Alfred Vitale

item.title: TCTC #39, 2-13-07
item.itunes:author: Thelema Coast to Coast
item.itunes:summary: Thelema Coast to Coast show #39; Opening Remarks; New Thelemic Announcement Mailing List: HRILIU; Listener feedback; Discussion with Gerry Cornelius about his new publication, Cornelia; Discussion with Keith418 about Freudian Psychology and the Father Figure; Interview with Lon DuQuette about his new books, Accidental Christ and The Key to Solomons Key; Closing remarks; Closing music: I Love to Get Drunk in the Car by Lon DuQuette

item.title: TCTC #38, 1-21-07
item.itunes:author: Thelema Coast to Coast
item.itunes:summary: Thelema Coast to Coast show #38; Opening Remarks; Listener feedback with the assistance of David Shoemaker; Discussion with Nicole Klagsbrun about her gallerys exhibit of Marjorie Cameron Parson Kimmels artwor; Discussion with Keith418 about the family and its place in magical path and the thelemic community; Follow-up Interview with Jason Augustus Newcomb about his New Hermetics and his associated program; Closing remarks; Closing music: Liturgia Gnostica by Phosphoros
item.description: Thelema Coast to Coast show #38; Opening Remarks; Listener feedback with the assistance of David Shoemaker; Discussion with Nicole Klagsbrun about her gallerys exhibit of Marjorie Cameron Parson Kimmels artwor; Discussion with Keith418 about the family and its place in magical path and the thelemic community; Follow-up Interview with Jason Augustus Newcomb about his New Hermetics and his associated program; Closing remarks; Closing music: Liturgia Gnostica by Phosphoros
item.itunes:keywords: John L. Crow Thelema esoteric occult Aleister Crowley Ordo Templi Orientis OTO AA Pagan Keith418 Cameron Nicole Klagsbrun Jason Augustus Newcomb New Hermetics

item.title: TCTC #37, 12-10-06
item.itunes:author: Thelema Coast to Coast
item.itunes:summary: Thelema Coast to Coast show #37; Opening Remarks; Listener feedback - all Voicemail!; Discussion with Keith418 about Magick and religion and other aspects; Interview Roger Williamson regarding his books, business, paintings, and creation ones own magical system; Closing remarks; Closing music: Trust by Scholar
item.description: Thelema Coast to Coast show #37; Opening Remarks; Listener feedback - all Voicemail!; Discussion with Keith418 about Magick and religion and other aspects; Interview Roger Williamson regarding his books, business, paintings, and creation ones own magical system; Closing remarks; Closing music: Trust by Scholar

item.title: TCTC #36, 11-14-06
item.itunes:author: Thelema Coast to Coast
item.itunes:summary: Thelema Coast to Coast show #36; Opening Remarks; Listener feedback; Interview with David Shoemaker of the Temple of Thelema/College of Thelema; Discussion with Keith418 about Magick and its relation to the real world; Interview with Christopher Knowles, author of Symphony for the Devil, an essay about the creation of the Lucifer Rising soundtrack; Closing remarks; Closing music: Drug Money by Trole

item.title: TCTC #35, 10-27-06
item.itunes:author: Thelema Coast to Coast
item.itunes:summary: Thelema Coast to Coast show #35; Opening Remarks; Listener feedback about the OTO as a cult, publishing Crowley, and Thelema and Lonelygirl15; Interview with the founders of Ordo Magni Operis; Discussion with Keith418 about equality, desire, and transgression in Thelema; Interview with Stephen Skinner about his new book, The Complete Magicians Tables; Closing remarks; Closing music: Wolves by Inner Surge
item.description: Thelema Coast to Coast show #35; Opening Remarks; Listener feedback about the OTO as a cult, publishing Crowley, and Thelema and Lonelygirl15; Interview with the founders of Ordo Magni Operis; Discussion with Keith418 about equality, desire, and transgression in Thelema; Interview with Stephen Skinner about his new book, The Complete Magicians Tables; Closing remarks; Closing music: Wolves by Inner Surge
item.itunes:keywords: John L. Crow Thelema esoteric occult Aleister Crowley Ordo Templi Orientis OTO AA Pagan Scholar Cults Cult Tantra Stephen Skinner ORdo Magni Operis Lonelygirl15
